SEARCH

Class Utility

java.lang.Object
Utility
public class Utility extends Object
Class containing static helper methods for use in cryptographic computations.
Version:
1.1
Author:
JJ Coldiron (ecoldi@uw.edu), Markku-Juhani Saarinen, Paulo Barreto

  • Constructor Details

    • Utility

      public Utility()

  • Method Details

    • byteArray

      public static byte[] byteArray(long[] q)
      Converts an array of 25 longs into little-endian array of 200 bytes.
      Parameters:
      q - Array of 25 longs to be converted into bytes.
      Returns:
      Little-endian array of 200 bytes.

    • longArray

      public static long[] longArray(byte[] b)
      Converts a little-endian array of 200 bytes into 25 longs. Loosely inspired by capyCRYPT-go on GitHub.
      Parameters:
      b - Little-endian array of 200 bytes to be converted into longs.
      Returns:
      Array of 25 longs.

    • concat

      public static byte[] concat(byte[] a, byte[] b)
      Concatenates two byte arrays a and b.
      Parameters:
      a - The left array in the concatenation.
      b - The right array in the concatenation.
      Returns:
      a || b

    • rotl64

      public static long rotl64(long x, long y)
      Left rotates a 64-bit string by y bits. Adapted from Markku-Juhani Saarinen's C Implementation.
      Parameters:
      x - The 64-bit string to be left-rotated.
      y - The number of bits to left-rotate x.
      Returns:
      64-bit string left-rotated by y bits.

    • encode

      public static byte[] encode(byte[] x)
      Encodes byte array by prepending string length in bits. Written in accordance with the specifications defined in NIST Special Publication 800-185.
      Parameters:
      x - Data to be encoded.
      Returns:
      leftEncode(x) || x

    • leftEncode

      public static byte[] leftEncode(long x)
      Encodes x as a byte array so that it can be prepended to message with length x. This allows it to be unambiguously parsed from the beginning of the bit string. Written in accordance with NIST Special Publication 800-185.
      Parameters:
      x - The length to be encoded.
      Returns:
      A byte representation of x.

    • rightEncode

      public static byte[] rightEncode(long x)
      Encodes x as a byte array so that it can be prepended to message with length x. This allows it to be unambiguously parsed from the end of the bit string. Written in accordance with NIST Special Publication 800-185.
      Parameters:
      x - The length to be encoded.
      Returns:
      A byte representation of x.

    • bytepad

      public static byte[] bytepad(byte[] x, int w)
      Pad input out to the specified length according to NIST Special Publication 800-185. Adapted from Prof. Paulo Barreto's KMACXOF256 lecture slides.
      Parameters:
      x - The input to be padded.
      w - Encoding factor. (desired output length)
      Returns:
      The byte-padded array with encoding factor w.

    • byteToHex

      public static String byteToHex(byte[] in)
      Converts byte array to hex string. Adapted from several responses to this forum post.
      Parameters:
      in - Byte array to be converted.
      Returns:
      Hex representation of byte array.

    • hexToByte

      public static byte[] hexToByte(String hex)
      Converts hex string to byte array. Adapted from several responses to this forum post.
      Parameters:
      hex - Hex string to be converted to byte array.
      Returns:
      Byte representation of hex string.

    • hexByte

      private static byte hexByte(char c)
      Converts hex character into 4 bit-string. Called two characters at a time, with the first character being left-shifted by 4 to create a complete byte. Adapted from several responses to this forum post.
      Parameters:
      c - Hex character to be converted to string of 4-bits.
      Returns:
      4-bit representation of hex character.

    • readFileInput

      public static byte[] readFileInput(String fp)
      Parses through the user-provided file and returns a byte representation of its data.
      Parameters:
      fp - User-provided filepath for either input (args[0]) or password (args[2]).
      Returns:
      A byte representation of the data contained in the provided file.

    • readKey

      public static ECPoint readKey(String fp)
      Reads a public key in from the provided file.
      Parameters:
      fp - Filepath of the stored key.
      Returns:
      ECPoint stored in the provided file.
